title: Database Developer

details:
Open to candidates residing and are authorized to work in the US states.

Candidates must have the following skills:
 

Strong knowledge of MySQL and Oracle database systems; MS SQL Server experience a plus
Strong knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL)
Strong knowledge of database design, ERDs, schema creation  

 
POSITION TITLE: Database Developer
The Database Developer is responsible for taking business requirements and creating database schema to reflect the intent of the requirements. This position will also help other developers to write efficient complex queries, profile and optimize query code as well as use capabilities of the database to improve performance. General database administration experience is a strong plus.
 
Position Responsibilities and Essential Duties:

Ability to work efficiently with MySQL and Oracle databases; any experience with SQL Server a plus
Ensure data integrity and system performance for all of our databases
Create and maintain the database schemas based on business and project requirements
Understand the intended use of the database structures & help educate development team members on them
Write efficient complex queries; assist developers to do the same
Create upgrade scripts to move changes from development to production
Support database management and provide help for upgrade and migration of databases to new releases
Maintain database documentation
Advise and guide systems development team members on database/file design, performance monitoring and application/maintenance design and tuning
Troubleshoot the incidents and problems reported on database systems
Work with IT and Client Solution team members to ensure the database integrity, high availability and security
Help provide the root cause analysis on the major incidents/problems

 

 

Education/Experience:

3-5 years in DB Development with MySQL and/or Oracle
Bachelor's degree or higher preferred
Strong knowledge of MySQL and Oracle database systems; MS SQL Server experience a plus
Strong knowledge of Structured Query Language (SQL)
Strong knowledge of database design, ERDs, schema creation  
Scripting or programming experience a plus (Python/PHP)
Detail-oriented, strong analytical and problem solving skills
Excellent communication and team-building skills
Ability to work independently
Ability to interact with business users and executive management and translate business requirements into technical implementations

 
Ability to travel; estimate under 25%

details:
One of the leading financial services firm is looking to add a Database Developer to their funding technology group. You will be working closely with key business and technology stakeholders to build out the warehouse to support the data analytics needs of the securities lending and repo desks. One of the key areas of focus will be the continued build out of the warehouse to support the securities lending desk's market color reporting which provided to external clients.Their current warehouse is being migrated to the latest version of IBMs DB2 Database offering. You will have the opportunity to work with columnar and distributed databases and related technologies to build a high performance warehouse which will be capable of supporting the ever evolving analytic needs of the business.Reponsibilities:
Involvement in all aspects of support and building out of the data warehouse including capturing requirements, implementing new feeds, presenting data to users via various mediums including extracts, dashboards & data visualisations.
Work closely with various business stakeholders to understand their objectives and requirements. Distilling these into technology deliverables and taking ownership of their delivery across all stages of the development lifecycle.
working across all layers of the technology stack.
Qualifications:
Extensive experience in data modelling and SQL that you could utilise in this role and be comfortable working across all layers of the technology stack.
The ability to work across multiple work streams in order to achieve business deliverables.
Commercial experience of DB2
Experience working with Sybase
Expertise in SQL
Strong data modelling skills
Knowledge of scripting (Python/Perl)
Extensive knowledge of working in a Linux based environment

title: Database Developer

details:
Infogroup is looking for top talent to join our fast-paced and innovative team. We are seeking a Sr. Database Developer to join our Burlington, MA office. This position is responsible for the design, development, operation and analysis of the Company's database marketing systems.

Essential Job Functions:
1. Develop, code, update, and maintain database processes.

2. Modify, test, and support applications for the purpose of upgrading or enhancing database software.

3. Design and develop PL/SQL processes to perform complex ETL processes.

4. Develop Unix and Perl scripts for data auditing and automation.

5. Construct and design documents and documentation to aid in maintenance and code reuse in accordance with team processes and standards.

6. Develop strong working relationships with managers and analysts.

7. Participate in code reviews in accordance to standards.

8. Analyze data needs and independently develop logical and physical data models.

9. Coordinate the implementation of database application components.


10. Interact with key partners and internal users regarding timelines, technical issues, and infrastructure integration.
11. Understand and work with data in with varying degrees of complexity and scale.

12. Coordinate and participate in application testing and quality inspections.

Knowledge, Skill, and Abilities:
1. Knowledge of relational database, and programming processing concepts.

2. Knowledge of software development lifecycles and methodologies.

3. Possesses advanced software development and scripting skills for use in automation and interfacing with databases.

4. Knowledge of ETL tools.

5. Knowledge of Oracle/MS SQL database skills (SQL, PL/SQL, TSQL).

6. Knowledge of MySQL, SQL Server and SQL tuning.

7. Knowledge of developing procedures, packages and functions in DW environment.

8. Knowledge of Unix and Linux.

9. Knowledge of Service Oriented Architecture (SOA).

10. Ability to multi-task, to work under pressure, and think analytically.

11. Ability to work with minimal supervision and meet deadlines.

12. Ability to write technical specifications and documents.

13. Ability to communicate with individuals at all levels in the company and with various business contacts outside of the company in an articulate, professional manner.

14. Knowledge of CRM, MDM and Business Intelligence is a plus.


Education, Experience, and Certification:
1. Bachelor's degree or equivalent computer related field or equivalent is required.

2. 5+ years of related experience is required.

3. Experience using TalenD or Ab Initio is a plus.


We're revolutionizing the way companies connect with their customers and grow their businesses. Find out how you can join the movement at www.infogroup.com/about-infogroup/careers-at-infogroup. Please reference requisition number BURL4418.

Infogroup is the leading provider of innovative business data, and marketing solutions that are proven to increase customer acquisition and retention. Our mission is to use a combination of our client's data and our business and consumer data and really smart people to deliver the right communication to the right audience at the right time -- for Infogroup, that's real-time. For more information, please visit www.infogroup.com.

At Infogroup, our employees are directly responsible for our success. We strongly believe in rewarding employees for their initiative, teamwork and leadership. Every day, we expect our employees to ask questions, demand better solutions and challenge one another to succeed. We are constantly looking for candidates who are not only qualified and knowledgeable, but also have the drive to grow professionally. We hire dynamic individuals in variety of fields such as information technology, account management and client services, sales, marketing, administration and human resources.

Affirmative Action/EEO Policy
At Infogroup, we are committed to attracting, retaining and engaging employees from all walks of life. Diversity is an important part of our values and business operations. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive environment that promotes professional development for everyone. As part of that commitment, Infogroup does not discriminate on the basis of age, color, national origin, citizenship status, physical or mental disability, race, religion, creed, gender, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, marital status, status with regard to public assistance, status as a disabled veteran and/or Veteran of the Vietnam Era or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local law. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment. In addition, Infogroup will provide reasonable accommodation for otherwise qualified disabled individuals.

Location: Chicago, Illinois

details: Job #:   835957 Job Title: Database Developer  Location: Alpharetta, GA  Contract: 12+ months Description:   Works on problems of moderate and varied complexity where analysis of data may require adaptation of standardized practices or precedent. Acts independently to identify and select appropriate methodologies. Work customarily and regularly (50% of time or more) requires the exercise of discretion and independent judgment. Normally receives general instructions on non-routine work assignments. Requires additional instructions and frequent guidance on new assignments. Decisions are made independently. Assigned multiple tasks or projects are generally reviewed after completion. Contact is typically coordinates in nature and involves exchanging detailed technical information. May deal with both internal and external contacts. Demonstrates working knowledge in job-related functional area and of the business.     Minimum 7 to 8 years full SDLC development experience with Informatica Power Center 9.1. 6-7 years Oracle PL/SQL, SQL, Stored Procedures, Packages, SQL Navigator or similar 3-4 years Unix Shell scripting Working knowledge of the Data Transformation 8.6 or higher and how it integrates with Power Center. Full understanding of each data transformation type and ability to effectively implement into a mapping. Ability to trouble-shoot and solve configuration issues. Design and implement full solutions according to Business Requirements. Identify existing software defects and develop solutions Create design documents of work done for the project team. Can take ownership of assigned tasks and plan own time to ensure project milestones are met. very good understanding of database structures to support data integrity and performance, SQL, PL/SQL, query tuning The team member in this role will work on database systems critical to a great customer experience in or self service channel (web portals and mobile application).   JOB DUTIES:  Analyze architecture, including relationship between database tables and relationships of business data stored Analyze database design to understand impact on performance Recommend target database solution based on business and/or technical requirements - such as RDBMS vs. No SQL database Create high-performing database designs/code to retrieve large datasets and optimize system resources Tune poor performing SQL to run at optimized levels; exercise intermediate to advance practices to identify poorly performing code and identify areas to improve it Demonstrate capability to write DDL and SQL of low to medium complexity Execute database statements from Java code, including SQL statements, prepared statements, and stored procedures Analyze data, automate monitoring of very large datasets to identify data anomalies early to minimize impact to customer facing data, and write code to reconcile Encrypt data to restrict visibility of sensitive information Manage database updates across lower environments  Testing  Create and execute test plan to exercise functional and technical requirements.   Release Support  Verifying database schema and data patches applied correctly Monitoring database activity and log activity during release testing Investigate issues found during a release, assess customer and system impacts   MUST HAVE SKILLS:  Development experience with  Oracle 10g PostgreSql Database development IDE (Toad, Oracle SQL Developer, or other) SQL, DDL, Explain plan analysis   Experience with all phases of the Software Development Life cycle, including system analysis, design, coding, testing, debugging and documentation Excellent written and verbal communication skills Team player, collaborative Delivers excellent quality of code and documentation Critical thinker, good problem solver Can deliver assigned work independently Must have Informatica and PowerCenter (can be spelled as two words)  Must be able to create triggers, stored procedures, and performance tuning  SQL experience  Needs to be able to explain a time where they had to improve database performance   DESIRED SKILLS:  Cassandra design, development experience Elastic design, development experience Java OOM framework  EDUCATION REQUIREMENTS  BS in computer science, information systems, or other technical field is a plus but not required  REQUIRED SHIFT:  9am ET - 6pm ET

title: Database Developer

details:
Position:               Database Developer I
Department:        Information Technology
Reports To:     Manager – Data Management
Location:        Lenexa, KS
  OVERVIEW:  Grantham University was founded in 1951 by Donald Grantham, a WWII veteran with a desire to make education achievable for fellow military service members and veterans. Throughout the decades, Mr. Grantham’s vision has remained steadfast. Today, the 100 percent online university’s culture of service extends to all adult learners with a desire to improve their lives through higher education. Grantham’s commitment to affordability, accessibility and quality of its more than 50 undergraduate and graduate certificate and degree programs has earned Grantham University a distinguished record as a respected online learning university.
 
Grantham employees – or Life Changers – have access to a comprehensive and flexible benefits package, a celebrated corporate wellness program, paid volunteer opportunities and a shared commitment to making a difference for Grantham University students, each other and the community. Apply today!
 POSITION DESCRIPTION: Do you love databases like we do?  We are looking for someone who will support database processes across an array of MS SQL databases.  The incumbent will be responsible for the maintenance of database components, ETL processes, report creation, and database design. This role also supports Master Data Stores and Data Warehouse databases.  Strong knowledge of TSQL writing and optimizing as well as some PL/SQL is a must.  Must have experience in SSIS to support and create new ETL processes.  
 
 
KEY JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:
·         Perform Database programming development activities across various MS SQL databases
o    Write scripts to create databases and database objects.
o    Write scripts to create views, procedures, and functions in support of application development.
 
·         Maintenance of database components, data set transformation and loading, report creation, application interfaces, and business applications
o    Maintain packages and scripts to migrate data or perform ETLs.
o    Assist with design of logical and physical database or review description of changes to database design to understand how changes to be made affect physical database (how data is stored in terms of physical characteristics such as location, amount of space, and access method).
·         Maintenance of SSIS server
o    Ensure the SSIS servers are running as expected and that all jobs are completing on time.
o    Apply updates to SSIS servers
o    Ensure alerting of scheduled jobs is functioning as expected and alerts are being responded to in a timely fashion. 
·         Maintenance of data warehouse/ business intelligence components to include SQL Server, Report Services, Integration Services, and Analysis Services.
o    Maintain Multi-dimensional Cubes, Dimensions, Facts and data source view SSAS-Data Mining Models.
o    Maintain Tabular Cubes for reporting.
o    Maintain business level reports in Reporting Services
o    Maintain University and Department level Dashboards and reporting using MS Power View.  
 
·         Other duties as assigned
o    Direct programmers and analysts to make changes to database management system.
o    Train users and answer user questions.

EDUCATION/ WORK EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS AND DESIRED SKILLS:
 

2+ years working directly with SQL Server 2014/2012/2008  and/or Oracle
Understand relational database platforms 
Good analytic and problem-solving skills
2+ years of experience with demonstrated success in the database design, development and deployment. 
Hands on experience on database development in OLTP (TSQL) and OLAP (SSIS, SSRS and SSAS).

Preferred Work Experience and Qualifications:
 
Experience with T-SQL:
 

Relevant (i.e. Computer Science) Bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university is desired.  
Proficient in the use of T-SQL for developing complex Stored Procedures, Triggers, Tables, User Defined Functions, Views, Indexes, User profiles query writing and SQL joins.
Solid knowledge of Relational Database Management System (RDMS), Data Warehouse Concepts, OLTP and OLAP and demonstrated experience working on SSIS, SSAS, SSRS, Data Analysis, Data Cleansing/Data Scrubbing and Data Migration.
Work with T-SQL, DDL, and DML Scripts and established Relationships between Tables using Primary Keys and Foreign Keys.
Proven ability in Performance Tuning, Query Optimization and Running Database.
Understand of multi-dimensional analysis and design

 
 
Experience with SSIS:
 

Experience in creating complex SSIS and DTS packages for ETL purposes. 
Implement complicated Transformations to be used in SSIS packages.


Use Integration services (SSIS) to migrate data from one system to another and perform several transformations to ensure data integrity and validity.
Create SSIS Packages and involved in Package configurations and deployments between Development and QA and Production servers.

 
·            Able to effectively communicate orally (in person and by telephone) and in writing.
·            Able to multi-task, yet maintain close attention to detail and timeliness of work production.
·            Able to work in a positive team-oriented manner with a variety of people (students, faculty, staff, administrators, vendors, and members of the general public).
title: Database Developer I

details: Database Administrator/Developer - Dallas, TX  Basic Function This non-exempt position as MS SQL DBA will administer and optimize existing databases, and design and develop new database systems while working closely with a team of software engineers and system administrators. This individual will provide support, optimizations, and automation for series of external data feeds and internal relationships.   While this position primarily supports existing accounting and DM systems, it also directly supports the software development process, and it also includes rotating on-call assignments for top-tier production support and ongoing maintenance and reporting on existing systems. Essential Duties • Create new SQL language elements to include use of Common Table Expression's,    Apply/Cross Apply operators, logical and physical partitioning of data. (Knowledge will    be tested with current production code). Solid understanding of set-based-solutions.  • Database monitoring and tuning, including SQL Profiler, Windows System monitor,    indexing strategies and query/index tuning.  • Balance the needs of multiple projects and tasks simultaneously.  • Interact with large mission-critical application databases.  • Assist in performance monitoring, query tuning, and capacity planning  • Assist development team with debugging and optimization of SQL queries and stored    procedures. Other Duties • Will include table partition, replication, Microsoft SQL Clustering, and database    backup recovery automation  • Performs other related duties as needed or assigned. Reporting Relationship This position reports directly to the Manager of Infrastructure and Security.   Subordinate Staff: N/A Desired Education Bachelor’s Degree or certification Qualifications Knowledge/Experience: 5+ years’ experience designing and implementing database systems, including 3+ years’ experience designing and implementing SQL Server database systems using SQL Server 2005/2008 required (Microsoft Certified Professional Database Developer preferred).   • Ability to share product specific technical knowledge with peer developers.  • Experience with stored procedures, triggers, SQL scripts, and performance issues with    client/server database design and Data Access Layer design, including browser based    applications.  • Knowledgeable in the use of metadata for code generation and code that writes code    (highly desirable). • Experience with high-volume databases, index management,    physical database design, and server configuration settings.  • Knowledge in utilizing relational data modeling principles and techniques.  • Ability to share product specific technical knowledge with peer developers   Skills:  • Ability to communicate effectively and professionally with coworkers, peers, and    management through written and verbal communication.  • Ability to communicate with customers, internal departments, and other outside    parties who prefer different communication styles in a professional manner.  • Effectively communicate with developers and quality assurance staff in the resolution    of technical problems.  • Strong TSQL and SSIS skills.   Education: Bachelor’s Degree or certification and equivalent work experience. Physical Demands and Working Conditions Physical Demands: Possible server transport and setup. Must be able to move up to 70 lbs and perform hardware maintenance (rack mounting, cabling, networking, server setup) when requested by management. This position requires constant communication and exchange of information with the Firm attorneys, clients and staff; this position must be able to inspect and observe information on a computer screen at least 80% of the time.   Working Conditions: Office Environment. Some possible offsite projects. Overtime, weekends and occasional travel possible but very rare. Occasional off-hours (evenings and weekends) requests and troubleshooting possible. title: Database Developer job Pasadena

details:
Job Description:Smile America Partners is a nationwide dental service organization that provides services to students and military personnel. We are currently looking for an entry-level SQL Server database administrator that is eager to expand their skills and become an integral part of our IT team and the organization.Job Duties & Responsibilities:
Assist with installing, configuring, troubleshooting, performance tuning and maintaining Microsoft SQL Server
Maintain and support custom reporting out of various databases
Contribute to and review requirements and specifications
Maintain and support multiple ongoing IT related projects
Assist in maintaining effective source control
Assist in the definition and development of database documentation and standards
Ability to occasionally work off-hours to upgrade and maintain company systems 
Skills Needed:
1 or more years of experience in designing and supporting databases through college, internship, or related job
Experience with Microsoft SQL Server and SQL Server Management Studio
Experience with Transact-SQL including the creation of indexes, stored procedures, and triggers
Experience with SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) 
Added Value – “Skills you’ll learn”
Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS)
Experience with MySQL
Knowledge of Microsoft Visual Studio and Team Foundation Server (TFS)
Experience with Microsoft Dynamics GP
Experience with .NET application/web integration with SQL Server
Experience with Microsoft Hyper-V and virtual server environments 
Company Benefits Offered
Paid Time Off
Certification Exam Reimbursement
Medical, Dental & Vision Plans
Employer Paid Basic Life Insurance and AD&D
Employer Paid Long Term Disability


Who We Are

Smile America Partners is the nation's leading in-school dental program founded almost two decades ago by two moms, who happen to also be dentists. The founders saw a tremendous need among underserved school aged children who did not have easy access to dental care and who often suffered from poor oral hygiene, tooth decay, pain and associated medical problems. Knowing that many parents could not take their children to the dentist due to issues including time off from work and transportation challenges, they sought to bring the care to the need. Today, through its dental partners, Smile America Partners provides preventive and restorative care to approximately 500,000 children per year.Tooth decay is the most common, and preventable disease among children, more common than asthma. In fact, each year, over 51 million school hours are lost due to oral health related issues.Smile America Partners affiliates with state licensed dentists, hygienists and assistants who use state-of-the-art portable equipment to provide all services onsite, directly in the school or in a self-contained mobile dental facility on site at the school. If portable equipment is used, classrooms, auditoriums or other school venues are literally transformed into fully functional dental offices for the day. Our expertise, obtained through years of experience bringing mobile dental care to schools, as well as through our highly qualified staff, enables us to bring exceptional care with minimal disruption to the normal school routine.Smile America Partners is currently active in 20 states and has ongoing strategic partnerships with over 8,000 school districts, including 21 of the 25 largest school districts in the country.Given the ongoing lack of access for many underserved children across the country, our services are in great demand and we are always looking for caring, compassionate professionals to join our team and play their part in making a difference in the lives of today's underserved children.Rewarding Work. Competitive Compensation. Smile America Partners.Smile America Partners is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation or protected veteran status.

title: Database Developer

details:
Job #:   827448 Apex Systems is seeking a Senior Database Developer to work in our Dahlgren,VA office.   Job Description: The Program The Senior Database Developer will be part of a team of experts charged with providing support in the areas of cyber analysis and cyber development capabilities in response to Navy’s and DoD’s needs for Cyber Situational Awareness (SA), Cyber Command and Control (C2), Mission Assurance, and Homeland Defense. Program scope includes identifying cyber key terrain by analyzing operational requirements, conducting cyber analyses and assessments, and developing and performing modeling and simulation in support of different cyber threat scenarios. The team will conduct cyber analyses and assessments to identify potential vulnerabilities and risks, determine mission and operational impacts, and make appropriate mitigation recommendations. Additionally, program support includes developing methodology and framework in support of cyber risk assessment life cycle. Our team will provide capabilities to support the customer with rapid design, development, test, deployment, maintenance and operation of specific software and hardware capabilities to meet current Cyber Defensive needs.   The Role As a Senior Database Developer on this program, you will use your expertise and experience in the following areas and activities to deliver solutions and services to our customer: DB Developer will focus on SQL Server Database performance optimization, tuning, and monitoring services to ensure optimal MS SQL Server performance, reliability and data integrity.  It is almost always the case that deficient database design or implementation issues are the primary root-cause behind poor SQL Server performance and unreliable system or poor data integrity.  Review and assess existing enterprise data-driven applications, to support new features, performance improvements, upgrades, and ongoing sustainment Analyze large, complex systems to determine performance bottlenecks, application bugs, and opportunities to improve efficiency Capture and analyze database activity to identify improvements in indexing, file structure, maintenance processes, and query performance Plan and conduct database architecture assessments that examine DBMS and database configuration and performance Identify areas of instability and deviations from best practices with database components Participate in performance, load, and stress testing, and remediation of issues identified Participate in security architecture reviews of large enterprise systems Lead efforts to design and implement changes to data models for new and existing applications Participate in all aspects of the application lifecycle: requirements analysis & definition, system design, implementation, testing, deployment, and sustainment Participate in activities that ensure the successful use of these systems including: developing documentation, test scripts, and training materials  


In order to be successful in this job, we expect that qualified candidates will have the following skills, experience, and credentials:

Active Top Secret Clearance (Min Interim Top Secret)
Current CompTIA Security+ certification (DoD 8570 IAT Level 2 preferred)
Current MCP or MCSA Microsoft Certification
Experience designing, deploying, and maintaining SQL Server infrastructures on version 2008/2008R2/2012/2014
Strong understanding of complex data sets and designing data structures
Expert level development skills using T-SQL, PL/SQL, PostgreSQL, etc.
Strong experience with data replication, performance tuning and script validation.
Expert level skills designing and implementing redundant and scalable SQL Server infrastructures using technologies including database mirroring, log shipping, replication, Always On Availability Groups, etc.
Proficiency with SQL Server Integration Services, SQL Server Reporting Services, SQL Profiler, and SQL Server Management Studio
Proficiency in query optimization
Experience designing, implementing, supporting, and analyzing enterprise scale applications that perform extract/transform/load (ETL) operations with external data sources and SQL Server
Seven (7) years of experience in the above listed areas

Fostering Teamwork: The ability and desire to work cooperatively with others on a team; demonstrate interest, skill and success in getting groups to learn to work together.

Initiative: Indentifying what needs to be done and doing it before being asked or before the situation requires it.

title: Database Developer I

details:
Summary -
Analyzes, designs, programs, debugs, and modifies Oracle based database applications that form a part of integrated software solutions used in local, networked, or Internet-related application suites. Work with complex data models and object relational database structures. Write database PL/SQL packages, procedures and triggers according to the business requirements. Work with a development team in the design, development, testing, tuning and implementation of database applications. Completes documentation and procedures for installation and maintenance. May interact with users to define system requirements and/or necessary modifications.
 
Essential Duties and Responsibilities -
60% Development, coding, testing and integration.
20% Support and Troubleshooting of data issues.
10% Documentation, training and support.
10% Requirement capture and analysis.
 
Requirements:                                                                   
                                                                                             Education: Bachelor’ s degree in computer science or related field.

6 - 8 years of experience in database development and design
Proficiency in Oracle 10g, 11g, PL/SQL
Proficient in understanding Data Models and relationships to be able to write complex queries
Strong Analytical skills to triage various production issues and provide fixes/solutions
Experience with SQL Developer, SQL Plus, Toad and/or other Oracle application tools
Experience handling LOB objects
Experience with Data Modeling tools like ER-Win
Experience with scripting languages such as Shell, Perl
Proven experience developing and performance tuning large scale enterprise database applications with high transactional volume
In-depth knowledge of various Oracle objects and PL/SQL features
Experience in developing business scenarios, process flows/models, test cases and scripts
Strong technical documentation ability
Strong verbal communication skills and a demonstrated ability to work effectively in team-based development projects

Preferred Experience          

Experience with Team Foundation Server for release management and defect tracking.
Familiarity with multiple Operating Systems (Unix, Linux, Windows)

            Certifications/Licenses: OCP and OCA certifications are a plus

title: Database Developer

details:
Company DescriptionOur client is an internationally known evangelical Christian broadcasting ministry based in Atlanta, GA.Job DescriptionThe Microsoft SQL DBA / Database Developer Lead, also called Database Director internally, will provide support for the organization's donor management and CRM tool called DonorDirect. This role will report to the Director of IT and be responsible for the implementation, configuration, maintenance, and performance of an Microsoft SQL Database. This role will also be responsible for the development of custom reports for various departments, including Donor Relations, Marketing, Finance & Accounting, and the Executive Team. We are looking for a results oriented individual who is passionate about helping their customers and won't rest until the job gets done! This is an opportunity to put your technical skills to work in support of a mission that includes production and broadcasting of Gospel-centered programming, field ministry teams engaged in evangelism and discipleship, and help for the persecuted church.Specific responsibilities include:
Maintenance and support of SQL Server components.
Ongoing and new development of custom SQL Server solutions.
Database support for assigned applications.
Database support for deployment, implementation and training activities for Donor Direct suite of applications.
Documentation of SQL Server infrastructure, data policies, and Extract/Transfer/Load (ETL) processes.
Development, implementation, and support of custom SSRS and SSAS reports.
Maintaining clear and open communication with department managers and users across the ministry.
Evaluate, report, troubleshoot and resolve identified data and reporting challenges.
Confirms project requirements by studying user requirements and conferring with others on project team.
Manage user requests by urgency and priority and communicate realistic delivery.
Maintain database documentation.
Develop on an ongoing basis an understanding of all database systems, and maintaining an ongoing awareness of desired needs and challenges to ensure solutions are researched and provided in a timely manner.
Prepare for database expansion by studying plans and requirements; advising senior technical management; coordinating design, programming and testing as well as engaging and educating users of functional changes prior to implementation.
Recommend and oversee upgrades of software by assessing transaction processing and database production options.
Participate in project meetings with the donor development team to plan upcoming releases, discuss outstanding issues, and make enhancement priority decisions.
Maintain to-do list displaying current projects, recurring tasks, and completed projects.

As a Christian ministry organization, employees come from a broad range of church backgrounds. To make sure everyone understands their theological foundations, our client requires that all employees subscribe to the following doctrinal statement:
We believe the Bible to be inspired, the only infallible Word of God
We believe that there is one God, eternally existent in three Persons: Father, Son and Holy Spirit
We believe in the deity of Christ, in His virgin birth, in His sinless life, in His miracles, in His vicarious and atoning death through His shed blood, in His bodily resurrection, in His ascension to the right hand of the Father, and in His personal return in power and glory
We believe that for the salvation of lost and sinful man, regeneration by the Holy Spirit is absolutely essential
We believe in the present ministry of the Holy Spirit, by whose indwelling the Christian is enabled to live a godly life
We believe in the resurrection of both the saved and the lost, they that are saved unto the resurrection of life and that that are lost unto the resurrection of damnation
We believe in the spiritual unity of believers in Christ


Qualifications
Must be in agreement with the above doctrinal statement.
A bachelor's degree is preferred, but not required.

5 or more years of experience in data maintenance and database management, database design and API's.
Strong knowledge and experience with MSSQL, SSMS, SSRS, Version Control, Data Mining, Data Analysis.
The following certifications are a plus: MCDBA, MCSA or MCSE.
Must be in agreement with the organization's doctrinal statement of faith.
Additional InformationThis is a full time, salaried position with health/medical and other benefits.The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required. This position may be required to perform duties outside of the normal responsibilities from time to time.
title: DBA / Database Developer Lead

details:
Job ID: 45432 Database DeveloperJob DescriptionOVERVIEW:We are seeking an experienced SQL Server Developer to participate in database development and database administration for enterprise-level software products. This position will focus on TSQL coding, issue remediation, and providing development support for application developers at a project level. The candidate will also be required to assist with performance tuning, production bug fixes, and help to guide process improvement within the DBA group. The ideal candidate will have at least five years' experience in SQL development or administration, will possess an expert understanding of the SQL Server architecture, administration, security, and will demonstrate a solid grasp of advanced TSQL coding techniques focusing on performance. Experience with merge replication setup, management, and troubleshooting are a plus for this position.ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:Candidate will work on a team that is responsible for developing, customizing, supporting, and deploying PME database applications for clients. Required skill set for this position is as follows:
Collaborate with product owners and or the team's database architect to improve upon database designs and performance
Work with Business Analysts to properly document design as well as assist with exploring possible database designs for future enhancements.
Work with project team to create efficient, flexible, and scalable database.
Develop Triggers to validate data and protect the database.
Create required TSQL and CLR stored procedures to support API or application development.
Assist in mentoring application programmers in the creation of stored procedures
Create functions and views as needed to enhance business process or database performance.
Work with the Database administrations team to enhance internal tracking and analysis tools
Work with Database Administration manager to improve application delivery processes and procedures.
Work with application support personnel to assist with defining application enhancement requests.
Assist with application integration of existing third-party applications for internal and external clients.
Assist with custom deployment projects as needed
Assist with data migrations from old system to new system when installation is replacing an existing system. Again as needed
Identify and act upon opportunities for improving the company’s databases
Maintain quality service by establishing and enforcing organization standards.
Maintain professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; benchmarking state-of-the-art practices; participating in professional societies
ADDITIONAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:In addition to the responsibilities mentioned above, tasks relating to the following area will be assigned as required:
Company Engineering meetings
Interaction with current and potential customers regarding the use of the company’s Engineering tools
Provide feedback on product needs and processes
Education/Training
ESSENTIAL KNOWLEDGE & SKILLS:Required Education and Training:
BS in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, or equivalent
At least five years' experience in database administration or development with MS-SQL Server 2008R2 and two years’ experience developing within SQL Server 2016
Required Specialized Knowledge and Skills:
Solid understanding of relational database modeling concepts
Eight or more years of database development experience
Development work utilizing SQL Server 2016 TSQL enhancements a plus
Database Modeling experience (OLTP) DM andDW would be a plus
Proficient in TSQL performance tuning techniques.
Experience with implementing multiple schemes and security management
Proficient in C# for CLR Procedures
Working Knowledge of SSIS package development utilizing transactions and logging
Experience with SSRS and SSAS are a plus
SQL server administration experience. You also have the basics of running Microsoft SQL Server - users, permission, backups, recovery, monitoring, and that sort of thing.
Working knowledge of SQL Server 2016 security model is a plus
Experience with file stream is a plus
Experience managing a 'Big Data' or NOSQL environment is a plus
Sound knowledge of waterfall and agile software development methodologies
Strong knowledge of systems and software development lifecycles; application integration techniques;
Excellent skill in communicating orally and in writing with people
Excellent troubleshooting ability
Highly effective working in a team, as well as working independently
Proficient working on various projects together at the same time
Preferred Specialized Knowledge and Skills:
Professional experience developing with MS-SQL Server 2016
Experience working with customers of varying levels of technical expertise
Good understanding of .Net programming, HTML, CSS, and web programming is a plus
Type of Equipment Used:MS/Windows servers, workstations, laptops and tablet PCsWork Environment/Physical Demands:
Long hours may be required
Stress may occur periodically
Limited amounts of travel may be required

Must have SQL Server 2016
5 years min exp.
T/SQL coding
CLR, C# experience

details:
Database Administrator II


Computershare is a global market leader in transfer agency and share registration, employee equity plans, mortgage servicing, proxy solicitation and stakeholder communications. We also specialize in corporate trust, bankruptcy, class action and utility administration, and a range of other diversified financial and governance services.

Founded in 1978, Computershare is renowned for our expertise in high integrity data management, high volume transaction processing and reconciliations, payments and stakeholder engagement. Many of the world’s leading organizations partner with us to streamline and maximize the value of relationships with their investors, employees, creditors and customers.

Computershare is represented in all major global financial markets and has over 16,000 employees worldwide who are key to delivering exceptional value and outcomes.  Our career opportunities span many business units, including Computershare Loan Services and Kurtzman Carson Consultants – join our growing team of financial services professionals!

 
Job Summary

Responsible for the design, development and database administration of SQL Server databases used by associates, customers and investors. Designs and develops database applications and processes in a Microsoft development environment and will be responsible for adhering to current SLS development procedures and techniques.

Position Responsibilities and Essential Functions


Lead the technical design, development, testing and implementation of SQL Server based applications utilizing SLS standard development procedures and techniques that support the requirements defined by users and analysts. Ensure that standards for database performance, availability and security are being met.
perform proactive performance consultation, design, tuning, and planning. Responsible for suggesting, reviewing and justifying new technical tools and techniques and managing their implementation. 


Translate and document customer requirements, recommend system solutions, and formulate detailed specifications from which enterprise applications are developed. Work closely with business partners to produce quality products that meet business needs. Implement solutions following the complete Software Development Lifecycle (SLDC), including requirements gathering, design, specifications, development, change management, testing and deployment activities. 


Work collaboratively with team members and business partners in defining, designing, developing and implementing technology solutions to improve business functions. 


Analyze database applications/queries and implement improvements to optimize performance. 


Develop system documentation for all developed applications databases, processes, and jobs, including flowcharts and data models. 


Understand the total SLS IT computing environment and daily operations and understand the impact of planned changes. Provide tiered production support including limited on-call. 


Other duties or tasks as assigned by management.


The above information on this description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this classification. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.

Qualifications

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Skills


Strong understanding of how to maximize SQL Server application scalability, performance, recoverability, and maintainability.


Demonstrated ability to balance multiple concurrent projects of varying priorities and shift focus from one project to another with minimal loss of productivity or quality.


Demonstrated experience with adhering to usability, design and development standards.


Demonstrated experience with all aspects of unit testing, performance testing and user acceptance testing.


In-depth experience with the development lifecycle and software development methodologies.


A strong understanding of technical and infrastructure environments (data communications, web technologies, network, SAN, security, etc.)


Demonstrated experience with large scale database design and development on the Microsoft SQL Server platforms including normalization techniques, ETL, writing stored procedures, performance tuning etc


Solid understanding of SQL Server locking, indexing and error handling, and basic administration tasks.


Ability to meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.


Ability to work in a collaborative, dynamic team environment and interact at all levels to ensure reliability, availability, scalability, and performance of applications.


Excellent organizational, time management, and project planning/strategizing skills.


Experience with other Microsoft languages and technologies, including MSMQ, Sharepoint, Visual Studio Team System (VSTS), and Team Foundation Server a plus.


Loan servicing or mortgage lending experience preferred.


Strong verbal and written communication skills.


Strong analytical and problem resolution skills.


Education 


Microsoft Certified Technology Specialist Certification Preferred.


B.S. or B.A. in Computer Science or equivalent work experience preferred.


Experience



Minimum of 3 years experience with developing SQL Server applications and optimization including DDL, DML, stored procedures, triggers, SSIS, and performance tuning preferred


Minimum of 3 years of relational database experience within a multi-tiered environment; including use of database performance and monitoring tools preferred.


Language Ability

Ability to read/analyze/interpret business periodicals/ journals/technical procedures/gov. regulations; write reports/business correspondence/procedure manuals; effectively present information/respond to questions from managers/clients/customers/public.

Mathematical Ability

Ability to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, area, circumference, and volume.  Ability to apply concepts of basic algebra and geometry.

Work Environment

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


The noise level in the environment is moderate.


Physical Requirements

The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.



While performing the duties of this job the employee is regularly required to talk or hear. The employee is frequently required to sit, stand, walk, reach with hands and arms, and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee may occasionally have reason to lift up to 10 pounds. The vision requirements include close and distant vision.


Computershare is an Equal Opportunity Employer.  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national or ethnic origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

This job specification should not be construed to imply that these requirements are the exclusive standards of the position.  Incumbents will follow any other instructions and perform any other related duties as may be required by business needs and communicated by their supervisor.

#ZR

#D

The Kapsch portfolio of Advanced Traffic Management (ATM) services includes over 40 systems that integrate ATMS, SCADA (Supervisory Control and Data Acquisition), and automation for collecting real-time traffic and facilities-related data from highways, managed lanes, bridges, and tunnels. This information is delivered to a traffic management center where it is processed for actionable use by road operators, government authorities, and road users.


Our tolling solutions span all-electronic toll collection in free-flow traffic, automated payment at conventional toll plazas, and city tolling. Our solutions comprise radio communication via micro waves, vehicle tracking via GNSS (Global Navigation Satellite Systems), ALPR (Automatic License Plate Recognition) video tolling, and vehicle classification via video and laser sensors LVDC (Laser Vehicle Detection and Classification). Our systems can manage operations for areas ranging from individual roads to entire regions, and can be modified for distance-based or time-based charging.  


Our combined intelligent mobility solutions are used to aid traffic management personnel in making critical decisions during emergency response situations, as well as for providing real-time traffic information to road users from the highway to the city.


Kapsch TrafficCom is a leading global provider of intelligent transportation systems (ITS) and offers  solutions  across  our  customers’  entire  value  chain  –  from  single  products  and components, to fully integrated turnkey systems and solutions in the applications of electronic toll collection, commercial vehicle operations, and highway traffic management. The Company is headquartered in Vienna, Austria with North American headquarters in McLean, Virginia and offices throughout the United States (Virginia, Georgia, New York, New Jersey, Texas, California), Canada (Mississauga) and Mexico (Mexico City).


Kapsch TrafficCom is an equal opportunity employer.  All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, creed, color, national origin, ancestry, marital status or sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, disability, nationality or sex.


Kapsch TrafficCom is a drug-free workplace.

title: Database Developer, Senior

details:
Position Summary:
As a member of the Enterprise Applications team, the Database Administrator (DBA)/Developer will work with the existing database administrator, the Application Development team, and business stakeholders to plan, design, and deliver software solutions for the business.
The DBA must be familiar with database design concepts, methods for creating highly available environments, industry standards for security and integrity, options for integrating onsite and hosted data sources, tools for monitoring and tuning database instances, and programming techniques for writing efficient queries.  In addition, the DBA must be able to effectively establish and document requirements, track and report on projects, publish technical documentation of solutions, and research and understand best practices and regulatory obligations.
The right candidate will ideally have past hands-on experience administering MS SQL databases running in a public cloud environment such as AWS or MS Azure.


 Essential Duties and Responsibilities:

Assess the health of databases,  articulate issues, and formulate resolutions to improve health and performance
Design, build, analyze, tune, back up, and support databases
Understand and able to troubleshoot and maintain database servers
Take proactive measures to monitor, trend, and tune SQL databases, such as running maintenance jobs (backups, DBCCs, applying indexes/re-indexing, etc.), to meet or exceed baseline stability and performance SLAs
Develop and maintain SQL stored procedures, views, functions, ETL programs, and ad-hoc queries to support business needs
Develop, schedule, and monitor SSIS packages
Integrate data from various back-end databases and data sources
Manage and audit user access to DEV/TEST and PROD databases
Analyze business system requirements and design appropriate technical solutions
Develop system documentation as needed, including technical and user documentation
Keep up to date in emerging technologies/industry trends and apply them to ZOLL’s operations
Other duties as assigned by management


Supervisory Responsibilities: None


Qualifications:
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.  The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills, and abilities required.  Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions of this job.


Educations and/or Experience:


Bachelor’s Degree in information technology or a related field or equivalent work experience
3+ years’ experience administering and maintaining replicated Microsoft SQL Server databases in a distributed production environment
1+ years of Azure administration will be a huge plus.
Expert proficiency with Microsoft environment and tools, such as Enterprise Manager, Query Analyzer, and Profiler
Development experience with SSRS, SSIS, and automating SQL Server deployment and configuration through PowerShell, Chef, etc.
Experience with PowerShell scripting
Proficiency with query optimization, SQL development, parameterized queries, and T-SQL for developing complex stored procedures, triggers, etc.                                                                                                                                                                       

Language Skills: 
Ability to read and comprehend simple instructions, short correspondence, and memos.  Ability to write simple correspondence.  Ability to effectively present information in one-on-one and small group situations to customers, clients, and other employees of the organization.


Mathematical Skills:                                                                                                                                                
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. 


Reasoning Ability:                                                                                                                                                                    
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out instructions furnished in written, oral, or diagram form.  Ability to deal with problems and make appropriate judgment calls to insure the correct outcome.


Computer Skills:                                                                                                                                                                       
To perform this job successfully, an individual should be proficient in SQL, T-SQL.  Understanding and working knowledge of HTML, CSS, ASP and .Net required.


Physical Demands:
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is frequently required to sit, walk, talk and hear.  Employee may occasionally be required to lift and carry up to 25 pounds.


Work Environment:
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
 The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.


ZOLL is an Equal Opportunity Employer - minorities/females/veterans/individuals with disabilities/sexual orientation/gender identity.

title: Database Developer

details:
HealthTrust (Healthtrust Purchasing Group, L.P.) is committed to strengthening provider performance and clinical excellence through an aligned membership model and the delivery of total spend management advisory solutions that leverage its operator experience, scale and innovation. Headquartered in Nashville, Tennessee, HealthTrust (www.healthtrustpg.com) serves over 1,500 hospitals and health systems, and more than 31,000 other member locations including ambulatory surgery centers, physician practices, long-term care and alternate care sites. On Twitter @healthtrustpg. JOB SUMMARY –InVivoLink is a rapidly emerging health care technology company based in Nashville. Our next generation software helps hospitals and surgeons optimize care delivery for surgical patients. InVivoLink is growing quickly and is looking for highly talented, creative people who are fun to work with and communicate really well.The Senior DBA plays a hands-on role in development of InVivoLink’s thought-leading clinically-integrated business platforms. This position plays a leading role in architecting, designing, implementing and maintaining our cutting edge software solutions.DUTIES (included but not limited to) –
Responsible for the daily administration, support, maintenance, availability, patching, performance, security, and backups of InVivoLink’s SQL Server database infrastructure.
Lead in the architecture, design, development, and implementation of SQL Server databases.
Evaluate, diagnose, research, analyze and provide options to resolve database, server performance and related problems.
Database performance monitoring and index tuning.
Focus on SQL Server scalability, availability, and recovery.
Troubleshoot database and server performance problems, including issues with SQL Server high availability solutions.
Act as subject matter expert for database development, performance, and scalability.
High quality SQL that conforms to design and functional requirements.
Provide support to other development engineers, QA personnel, and product management leaders.
Support staff in areas of expertise and domain knowledge.
Support and provide input for feature definition and analysis.
Present information on projects, initiatives or other subjects to peers and upper management.
Maintain and implement Disaster Recovery planning from a database point of view.
Code review database queries used in the system and provide optimizations.
 

Education Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in computer science or engineering discipline Experience 8 years relevant work experience

Strong knowledge and experience working with MySQL and MariaDB on Linux platforms

title: Database Developer

details:
Job Title: Lead Database Architecture Development
Location: Wynn
 
Job Description and Responsibilities:
Wynn Resorts is a Fortune 500 company led by hospitality industry visionary Steve Wynn. Currently operating in the top two casino gaming markets in the world, Wynn is financially stable and growth oriented. Our 12,000 employees at our Wynn Las Vegas and Encore properties have helped us win more Forbes Travel Guide Five-Star Awards than any other independent hotel company in the world. Wynn resorts are known for their innovative design, luxury offerings, and exceptional guest service. Joining Wynn means working for a leader in the global resort industry, one that has set today’s standards and will likely define them tomorrow.
Job Responsibilities : 
Wynn Las Vegas understands the incredible value of data management by integrating data from existing vendor-delivered systems with internally-architected advanced solutions. The Database Architecture Lead is a key member of the Wynn Las Vegas IT Development Team and is critical to implementing database architecture improvements for Wynn Las Vegas. This position reports to the Software Architecture Lead and plays a lead role in the areas of software development, enterprise scalability, and systems integration for Wynn Las Vegas.   • Manages a team of Database Developers responsible for delivering enterprise class database architectures and complex database objects used with n-tier enterprise application software.  • Translates business requirements, functional designs & information architectural specification in the areas of Marketing, Hotel, Gaming, Retail and Food & Beverage systems into technical designs for implementation of application architecture and interface development initiatives.  • Assists and mentors team members as they implement and code database objects from technical design specifications.  • Assists and mentors team members as they provide Tier 4 support for production issues and outages.  • Partners with the Software Architecture Lead to implement best of breed Enterprise Architecture designs that support key business objectives.  • Will lead team development implementation efforts that bring together members from multiple systems, teams, and lines of business.  • Advocates and implements standards, best practices, product development processes, technical design practices, and quality assurance.  • Analyzes functional and business logic requirements/problems and objectively; applies sound judgment in assessing possible solutions.  • Assists in coding efforts to develop databases, optimizations, database enhancements and integrations that support business strategy & requirements with emphasis on on-time business delivery, performance, availability, scalability, security, maintainability, reliability, ease • Assists in creation and review of Development Project plans to determine project requirements and schedule Development Team project deliverables, milestones and required tasks. • Assigns duties to Database Developer team members including coding assignments, tasks and responsibilities • Direct and coordinate activities of Database Developer team members to ensure project progresses on schedule • Review status reports prepared by project personnel, and modify schedules or plans as required • Establish standards and procedures for developer team reporting and documentation efforts • Mentor team members providing technical advice and assisting to resolve technical implementation issues • Coordinate and respond to requests for changes from original specifications • Develop unit test plans • Develop a peer code review process and conduct code reviews at various stages in the development process. • Ensure team process to enter and track implementation information including work items, tasks and issue management in Team Foundation Server. • Develop and maintain build servers & team build processes • Author and manage release notes for each build for release to Quality Management
 
Job Requirements:

Solid understanding of n-tier enterprise application and system integrations development utilizing RDMS.
Mastery of architecting complex enterprise class solutions using database objects such as tables, views and stored procedures MS SQL Server 2000, 2005 and 2008.
Knowledge of/experience with middleware/integration platforms such as TIBCO and SOA preferred.
Solid understanding of the software development process, including requirement gathering, analysis/design, development tools/technologies, release/version management, contemporary testing methodologies and deployment methodologies.
Strong analysis, design and implementation experience with technologies.
Strong Experience with Data Modeling, Warehousing, Relational Database
Experience with other BI Tools with Business Objects, ECM, Archival experience a plus.
Strong experience with Data Mapping, Data Modeling, Data Mining, and Data Warehousing/Mart.
Two to four years of progressive broad-based information Data Warehouse development experience; highly desirable four or more years working with Teradata, Informatica, Oracle and MS SQL.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to develop and deliver projects using leading-edge technology.
Solid project management skills with ability to multitask and manage multiple small to large projects in a cross-functional environment.
Demonstrated ability to lead and motivate a team of developers and to apply skills and techniques to solve dynamic problems.
Ability to present and explain technical information in a way that establishes rapport, persuades others and gains understanding.
Strong teamwork and interpersonal skills at all management levels.
Ability to operate under a dual reporting relationship (IT, customers.
Bachelor's degree in computer science, engineering or a related discipline with an information technology focus or equivalent experience.
Must have 5-7 years experience in a senior role in MS SQL Database Development involving a formal development and test release process for n-tier client/server.
Must have 1-2 years in a Lead Database Developer or Architect role.
Experience with Service Oriented Architecture and/or Event Driven Architecture.
Strong problem solving skills.
Strong management and development skills.
Technical management experience in a dynamic high-technology environment — a key success factor.
A valid Nevada Gaming License is required and must be obtained before entering this position.
Must be 21 years of age or older.

title: ETL Developer

details:
We are seeking a full-time SR. Database administrator whose primary responsibilities will be the design, configuration, upkeep, and reliable operation of new and existing database systems across our project portfolio. In addition to improving and maintaining our existing environment, this role will also need cross-platform experience with new hosting platforms such as AWS RDS for MSSQL and Aurora. A passion for database system’s design and efficient implementation, a strong, self-guided interest in new and emerging technologies, and a love for defining and then executing standards and proper process are all a must-have.
This position will be based from your home in any location in the United States with minimal travel, however, preference will be given to candidates located in the Charlotte, NC, Winston-Salem, NC, and surrounding areas.
Key Deliverables:

Understand and define business requirements related to database systems design and operation and architect accordingly.
Respond to and resolve elevated database incidents and requests
Monitor, optimize and/or redesign existing database systems and related processes to improve efficiency and promote automation where possible.
Research and actively move our client towards innovative database technologies, trends, and best practices.
Architect and implement database security and operational policy under the umbrella of IT operations and in coordination with other technical teams.

Essential Duties:

Configures Microsoft SQL servers for development/QA/production
Supports database solutions, including performance monitoring, problem analysis and resolution, restorations from backup, restoration of replication, and ad hoc data analysis
Provides off-hours on-call incident response for elevated database related issues
Provides ongoing evaluation and recommendations on database technologies and architectures
Understands how hardware/network choices/issues affect SQL performance and configuration and provides subsequent guidance on systems design
Understands, recommends, implements and supports disaster recovery solutions for databases
Regularly serves as technical lead in development of database solutions
Regular cross-department communication with Data Analysts and Database Developers.

Required Qualifications:

5+ Years of experience working with MSSQL Server database system design and support, including performance tuning and optimization
Experience with T-SQL, stored procedures, indexes, views, execution plans, MSSQL Jobs, and backups
Strong analytical skills and problem solving, understanding all aspects of database hosting and application interaction from hardware and system design through operating system, database schema and application tier query/interaction.
Self-starter with ability to work under minimal supervision and prioritize multiple projects and responsibilities
A passion for the profession demonstrated by a progressive knowledge of new and emerging database technologies and platforms.

Preferred Qualifications:

Experience with other database platforms such as MySQL, Postgre, and AWS Aurora and cross-platform migration
Experience with at least one high-level programming language
Experience with Microsoft Active Directory as related to supporting MSSQL
Security focused experience related to database design and implementation such as data encryption, role-based access, and auditing.

Our client, headquartered in Fort Mill, SC, is a 17-year-old company with an established customer base. Our services include data management, analytics, web-based and logistics applications for consumer and business marketers across a variety of industries. We provide quantitative data management support as well as measurement, tracking, and reporting that influence and enhance the marketing strategies.
All applicants are subject to background checks and drug testing.

MSI is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin.
title: Sr. Database Administrator - 3415

details:
Interactive Business Systems is teaming up with a Dearborn company to search for and bring on  a Sr. Oracle DBA on a direct hire job opportunity!Essential Functions: Provide engineering, installation, configuration, maintenance and support in a 24/7 support environment. Monitor designated applications and take corrective action to prevent or minimize system down time. Perform the capacity planning required to create and maintain the Databases, working closely with system administration staff and other Database Administrators. Ability to think logically and analytically. 

Must have extensive hands on experience as a database developer/administrator capable of developing and analyzing highly complex system standards, thresholds and provide recommendations to maximize system performance. Identify and fix performance bottlenecks and tune the databases using traditional techniques and tools like Oracle OEM Grid, Splunk, TOAD etc. require knowledge on wait event tuning, session blocking, SQL and index tuning and SQL Profiles. 
Configure solutions for High Availability, Load balancing and fail over support. Follow disaster recovery policies and procedures; complete back-ups. 
Work closely with multiple departments as well as provide detailed status reports on assigned projects and ongoing support for assigned systems and applications. Implement changes into production environments to support change management and release scheduling. Coordinate efforts during production outages and work with other internal teams on root cause analysis and resolution thus ensuring performance of systems meet expected Service Level Agreements. 
Experience with High Availability systems like Exadata, Oracle RAC using version Oracle 11g, 12c.
QualificationsEducation: Bachelors Degree Computer ScienceExperience: 8-10 yrs Interested candidates should send a resume and brief cover note to the attention of Chris Douglas at Interactive Business Systems ([Click Here to Email Your Resumé]) IBS offers a competitive salary and comprehensive benefits package to all employees. Referral and sign-on bonuses may also be available. About IBS: IBS, Interactive Business Systems, Inc., is an IT solutions and staffing company known for achieving business objectives and bottom-line results through the smart architecting, implementation and management of technology. In three decades of developing the technology applications, tools, environments and teams that foster top business performance, we have become an industry-leading IT services provider.
title: Sr. Oracle DBA

details:
Overview
Vencore is a proven provider of information solutions, engineering and analytics for the U.S. Government. With more than 40 years of experience working in the defense, civilian and intelligence communities, Vencore designs, develops and delivers high impact, mission-critical services and solutions to overcome its customers most complex problems. Headquartered in Chantilly, Virginia, Vencore employs 3,800 engineers, analysts, IT specialists and other professionals who strive to be the best at everything they do. Vencore is an AA/EEO Employer - Minorities/Women/Veterans/Disabled and other protected categories

Responsibilities

Responsibilities: 
Designs, creates, and maintains Oracle databases in a client/server and web environment for mission critical production applications.
Conducts quality control and auditing of databases in a client/server and web environment to ensure accurate and appropriate use of data.
Troubleshoots production problems related to software applications and database transactions in application code as well as in stored procedures.
Advises users on access to various client/server and web databases.
Designs, implements, and maintains complex databases with respect to access methods, access time, device allocation, validation checks, organization, protection and security, documentation, and statistical methods.
Responsible for building and deploying database updates to real-time production, working with several environments and QA process.
Applies knowledge and experience with database technologies, development methodologies, and front-end/back-end programming languages (e.g., SQL).
Performs database programming and supports systems design.
Designs, develops and normalizes database schemas.
Provides maintenance of database dictionaries, overall monitoring of standards and procedures, file design and storage, and integration of systems through database design.

Analyzes user needs, develops user stories and decomposes to database solutions.
Addresses problems of systems integration, compatibility, and multiple platforms.
Reviews and optimizes PL/SQL statements.
Evaluates database design tradeoffs, impacts on user expectations and performance levels.Performs as part of an agile team, utilizing Kanban and Scrum best practices. Collaborates frequently with other team members. Mentors other DBAs across the agile teams. Shares best practices with all DBAs. 

Qualifications

Required


5+ years of relevant experience, with a Bachelor's in Computer Science, Engineering or other Technical degree preferred
Proficient in Oracle, specifically the ability to:

Install an Oracle database, set up infrastructure
Develop tables, stored procedures, functions
Apply upgrades, troubleshooting and monitoring procedures

Demonstrated ability to explain technical issues clearly/accurately to technical/non-technical audiences
Demonstrated ability to lead a team and mentor other DB Developers with adjusting priorities and deadlines
Desired Skills:
Oracle certification
Experience in the following technologies and tools: Microsoft .NET, Visual Basic (VB), C#
Proficient in PL/SQL

Experience with the following technologies:
.NET core
Node.js
Angular JS
HTML 5
Bootstrap


GitHub, JIRA experience
Familiarity or experience with DHS, specifically USCIS
Experience working in an Agile team
